page.title: 08 SARK SCHOOL
page.content: The Sark School was built in 1826. In 1850 Sark was the first place to make schooling compulsery in the British Isles. The school has thirtyfour children on it's school roll, ten infants, eight juniors and sixteen seniors. The school building doubles as a court and parliament. The junior and infant schools are built over old gravestones which where discovered when the foundations were laid. The building stands over the site of a medeival cemetry. Sark still retains the 11+ exam. If one passes one may go to the grammar school or Elizabeth College,both of which are on Guernsey.If you fail you stay on Sark and may go to Guernsey later. School begins at age 4\,but if there is no room then from 5 years,to 15.
